description: This TRAP is generated when an IPsec IKE Phase-1 Tunnel
is created.

event.Summary: IPsec IKE Phase-1 Tunnel is created

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD IPSECV1-MIB::ikeTunnelStart IPSECV1-MIB::ikeTunnelIndex i 9999 IPSECV1-MIB::ikeTunnelId s EXAMPLE

description: The index of the Phase-1 Tunnel table.
The value of the index is a number which begins at one and
is incremented with each tunnel that is created. The value
of this object will wrap at 65535.
variables.name: IPSECV1-MIB::ikeTunnelIndex

description: The internal ID of the Phase-1 Tunnel.
variables.name: IPSECV1-MIB::ikeTunnelId

description: This TRAP is generated when an IPsec IKE Phase-1 Tunnel
is stopped.

event.Summary: IPsec IKE Phase-1 Tunnel is stopped

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD IPSECV1-MIB::ikeTunnelStop IPSECV1-MIB::ikeTunnelIndex i 9999 IPSECV1-MIB::ikeTunnelId s EXAMPLE IPSECV1-MIB::ikeTunnelActiveTime t 31536000

description: The index of the Phase-1 Tunnel table.
The value of the index is a number which begins at one and
is incremented with each tunnel that is created. The value
of this object will wrap at 65535.
variables.name: IPSECV1-MIB::ikeTunnelIndex

description: The internal ID of the Phase-1 Tunnel.
variables.name: IPSECV1-MIB::ikeTunnelId

description: The length of time the tunnel has been active in
hundredths of seconds.
variables.name: IPSECV1-MIB::ikeTunnelActiveTime

description: This TRAP is generated when an IPsec Phase-2 Tunnel
is created.
The index of the Phase-2 Tunnel table.
The value of the index is a number which begins at one and
is incremented with each tunnel that is created. The value
of this object will wrap at 65535.
variables.name: IPSECV1-MIB::ipSecTunnelIndex

description: The internal ID of the Phase-2 Tunnel.
variables.name: IPSECV1-MIB::ipSecTunnelId

description: This TRAP is generated when an IPsec Phase-2 Tunnel
is stopped.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD IPSECV1-MIB::ipSecTunnelStop IPSECV1-MIB::ipSecTunnelIndex i 9999 IPSECV1-MIB::ipSecTunnelId i 9999 IPSECV1-MIB::ipSecTunnelActiveTime t 31536000

description: The index of the Phase-2 Tunnel table.
The value of the index is a number which begins at one and
is incremented with each tunnel that is created. The value
of this object will wrap at 65535.
variables.name: IPSECV1-MIB::ipSecTunnelIndex

description: The internal ID of the Phase-2 Tunnel.
variables.name: IPSECV1-MIB::ipSecTunnelId

description: The length of time the tunnel has been active in
hundredths of seconds.
variables.name: IPSECV1-MIB::ipSecTunnelActiveTime

description: This TRAP is generated when a IPsec Phase-2
authenication failure is detected.

event.Summary: IPsec Phase-2 authentication failed between $v4 and $v5

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD IPSECV1-MIB::ipSecAuthFail IPSECV1-MIB::ipSecTunnelIndex i 9999 IPSECV1-MIB::ipSecTunnelId i 9999 IPSECV1-MIB::ipSecFailTime t 31536000 IPSECV1-MIB::ipSecFailPktSrcAddr s EXAM IPSECV1-MIB::ipSecFailPktDstAddr s EXAM

description: The index of the Phase-2 Tunnel table.
The value of the index is a number which begins at one and
is incremented with each tunnel that is created. The value
of this object will wrap at 65535.
variables.name: IPSECV1-MIB::ipSecTunnelIndex

description: The internal ID of the Phase-2 Tunnel.
variables.name: IPSECV1-MIB::ipSecTunnelId

description: The time of the failure in hundredths of seconds.
variables.name: IPSECV1-MIB::ipSecFailTime

description: The packet's source IP address.
variables.name: IPSECV1-MIB::ipSecFailPktSrcAddr

description: The packet's destination IP address.
variables.name: IPSECV1-MIB::ipSecFailPktDstAddr

description: This TRAP is generated when a IPsec Phase-2
decryption failure is detected.

event.Summary: IPsec Phase-2 decryption failed between $v4 and $v5

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD IPSECV1-MIB::ipSecDecryptFail IPSECV1-MIB::ipSecTunnelIndex i 9999 IPSECV1-MIB::ipSecTunnelId i 9999 IPSECV1-MIB::ipSecFailTime t 31536000 IPSECV1-MIB::ipSecFailPktSrcAddr s EXAM IPSECV1-MIB::ipSecFailPktDstAddr s EXAM

description: The index of the Phase-2 Tunnel table.
The value of the index is a number which begins at one and
is incremented with each tunnel that is created. The value
of this object will wrap at 65535.
variables.name: IPSECV1-MIB::ipSecTunnelIndex

description: The internal ID of the Phase-2 Tunnel.
variables.name: IPSECV1-MIB::ipSecTunnelId

description: The time of the failure in hundredths of seconds.
variables.name: IPSECV1-MIB::ipSecFailTime

description: The packet's source IP address.
variables.name: IPSECV1-MIB::ipSecFailPktSrcAddr

description: The packet's destination IP address.
variables.name: IPSECV1-MIB::ipSecFailPktDstAddr
